group_1.textRight: It's been a while since we last went outside the@village. Are you finishing preparing your gift?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I am!@I made swaddling clothes for the baby!

group_1.textRight: The embroidery is so pretty!
You must've spent a long time preparing that,@and it shows.

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* Thank you, both of you!
Alright, then. Let's go!

group_1.textRight: Be careful, Jeanette!

group_1.textLeft: I will!@Liz will be with me, so we'll be fine.

group_1.textRight: So you'll be helping your relatives deliver the baby?

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
My uncle and his wife live in the village north of ours.
They'll be having their baby any day now!
We'll be staying there until the baby is born.

group_1.textRight: I thought there was a fortress up there.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, Vaucouleurs.@It's not exactly where we're going, though.
The lord of that keep is said to be a staunch@supporter...
...of the Dauphin: His Royal Highness@Prince Charles of France.

group_1.textCenter: (I feel like we've had this conversation before...)
(All this about the royal family...@and Dauphin Charles...)
(Why...can't I get it out of my head...?)

group_1.textRight: Uncle! It's good to see you again after all this time!

group_1.textLeft: There you are, Jeanette!@And...you must be Liz, right?

group_1.textRight: Yes. I'm a former mercenary.
These days, I serve as a town watch of sorts for@Domrémy.
She's incredibly strong!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I've heard a lot about you.
Apparently, you've been teaching Catherine a bit of@swordplay, too?

group_1.textRight: I thought she was much too young for it, but I just@couldn't bring myself to say no...

group_1.textLeft: Ahahaha!
It's hard to say no to a girl's request, eh?

group_1.textRight: Oh, before I forget― it's early, but here's a present@for you and the baby!

group_1.textLeft: What's this...? Hey, swaddling clothes! My wife'll be@thrilled!
Thank you! You're a great embroiderer, Jeanette.

group_1.textRight: No, no, I'm not, really...@I'm just a novice!

group_1.textLeft: ...Well, guess there's no point in avoiding it.@I'm afraid you two...
...will have to stay elsewhere tonight.@I'm really sorry about this.

group_1.textRight: Really? What happened?

group_1.textLeft: You see, yesterday, I was convinced my wife was in@labor. That put me in a panic up until recently.
As it turns out, I was only crying wolf, but all that@commotion meant I couldn't get your bed ready in@time.
Our neighbors agreed to let you stay with them,@though.
Would you guys mind spending the night there?

group_1.textRight: Of course!
...If that's the case, very well.

group_1.textLeft: Great. It's the house right across from the church.
There's a blind old woman who lives there with her@son and his wife.

group_1.textRight: I've been to their place before...
Her granddaughter― her daughter's child―@was visiting.
She was called Jeanette, just like me.
I remember it clearly!

group_1.textLeft: Oh yeah...about that.
...It's a sad story.
That girl...died the day before yesterday.

group_1.textRight: What?!

group_1.textLeft: There's been a plague in their village...

group_1.textRight: I didn't know that...@She was just my age, too.

group_1.textLeft: No one's broken it to her grandmother yet.
She's very old, and hasn't been doing so well lately.
She was very attached to her little girl, you know.

group_1.textRight: We'll have to make sure she doesn't find out.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah. That's the best thing we can do.
In any case, please come inside!
We can have dinner together before you go.
